{"step_by_step_thinking": "Glucosamine is a natural compound found in healthy cartilage, particularly in the fluid around the joints. For dietary supplements, it is harvested from shells of shellfish or can be made in the laboratory. It can be used in the form of glucosamine sulfate, glucosamine hydrochloride, or N-acetyl glucosamine. These supplements are often used to treat osteoarthritis, a type of arthritis. Niemann pick disease, Alzheimer's disease, and cancer are not typically treated with glucosamine.", "answer_choice": "A"}
